text: Table 2 Aetiology of pancreatitis Obstructive Choledocholithiasis: macrolithiasis (gall stoncs) or microlithiasis (‘biliary sludge’) Neoplasm: head of pancreas, peri-ampullary, metastascs (renal, gastric, breast, ovarian, and lung) Chronic aleoholism (thick, protcinaceous pancreatic secretions) Cystic fibrosis Congenital anomalies: pancreas divisum, choledochocoele Parenchymal Local and regional Trauma Blunt (road traffic accidents, bicycle handicbars, sports, non-accidental injury) Penetrating Operative (Iaparotomy) After ERCP, ES, or manometry Ischaemia (cholesterol emboli, vasculitides) Autoimmune discase (sclcrosing cholangitis) a-antitrypsin deficiency Global Hypoxacmia/ischacmia: SIRS, cardiac surgery Toxins: alcohol, drugs (e.g. oestrogens, steroids, furosemide, sulphonamides, and azathioprine) Hypothermia (particularly in the elderly) Hyperalimentation (parenteral nutrition) Hypercalcacmia / Hyperparathyroidism Viruses (c.g.
